text: On May 7 and June 7, 2005, the city of San Antonio, Texas held an election to choose who would serve as Mayor of San Antonio for a two year term to expire in 2007. Phil Hardberger won in a runoff against Julian Castro. == Results == {| class=wikitable !colspan=1 |Candidates !colspan=2 |General Election !colspan=2 |Run-off Election |- ! !Votes !% !Votes !% |- | Phil Hardberger | align="right" | 34,280 | align="right" | 30.05 | align="right" | 66,830 | align="right" | 51.47 |- | Julian Castro | align="right" | 47,893 | align="right" | 41.99 | align="right" | 63,001 | align="right" | 48.53 |- | Carroll Schubert | align="right" | 30,029 | align="right" | 26.32 | colspan=2 bgcolor=darkgray | |- | Julie Iris Oldham | align="right" | 919 | align="right" | 0.81 | colspan=2 bgcolor=darkgray | |- | Everett Caldwell | align="right" | 391 | align="right" | 0.34 | colspan=2 bgcolor=darkgray | |- | Rhett R. Smith | align="right" | 289 | align="right" | 0.25 | colspan=2 bgcolor=darkgray | |- | Michael Idrogo | align="right" | 270 | align="right" | 0.24 | colspan=2 bgcolor=darkgray | |- | Total | align="right" | 115,194 | align="right" | 100 | align="right" | 129,991 | align="right" | 100 |- |} ==References== Category:2005 Texas elections Category:2005 United States mayoral elections 2005 Category:21st century in San Antonio Category:Julian Castro
